item.title: How to Get Involved in Folkestone’s Future (Even if You’re Busy)
item.description: We all want to live in a town that feels welcoming, inspiring, and cared for. But for many of us, the thought of “getting involved” feels daunting. Who has hours of spare time these days? The good news is that supporting Folkestone’s future doesn’t require huge amounts of time. With Go Folkeston…

item.title: Why Local History Still Matters in a Modern Town
item.description: We live in a fast-paced world. Towns change, skylines shift, and new businesses come and go. It can be tempting to think heritage is something we leave in museums or history books. But in reality, local history is what gives a place its character – and without it, we risk losing not only o…

item.title: Small Acts, Big Change: How Community Projects Shape a Town
item.description: When you picture the kind of projects that change a town, you might think of large-scale developments or huge investments. But often, the most lasting impact comes from the small, consistent actions of people who care. That’s the heart of what Go Folkestone has been doing for more than 20 years …

item.title: Introduction to Large Format Cameras
item.description: Step into the world of large format photography! We’ll cover the essentials—from camera setup and proper film loading and handling, to mastering light metering for accurate exposures. We’ll also explore advanced camera movements like tilt, shift, and swing—powerful tools for creative contr…

item.title: b&w Film Developing
item.description:
Take creative control over your photography by learning how to develop black & white film at home. From contrast to grain, home development lets you shape your images exactly how you envision them.

Our hands-on class is perfect for beginners and enthusiasts alike – no prior e…

item.title: Come sing with SHEPWAY YOUTH VOICES
item.description:
If you know of ANY child of secondary school age, get them to come along to THE SHEPWAY YOUTH VOICES!  We rehearse on Wednesdays at 6.00pm to 7.15pm at Wood Avenue Library in Folkestone (CT19 6HS).

If you want to know any information at all about this AMAZING choir, led by the AMAZING Dunc…

item.title: Kent Choir Competition!!
item.description:
Hi everybody!

On 21st October we are hosting the Kent Choir Competition at The Leas Cliff Hall.  This is going to be an amazing event, with some great choirs competing!

Get your tickets from The Leas Cliff Hall box office.  It is going to be fab!

item.title: SHEPWAY VOICES CHRISTMAS CONCERT
item.description: T’will the the season to be jolly!  We can’t wait!  And to celebrate this fine season there will be the annual SHEPWAY VOICES CHRISTMAS CONCERT.  Date – 8th December.  Venue TBC.  BOOK IT INTO YOUR DIARY!!!!
